summary: Build "Whatchat", a WhatsApp-like messaging app with email-based login (no phone number) and user access to the app/codebase so they can make changes.
architectural_notes: Persist and restore the last signed-in account/session so the app can auto-login on subsequent launches (with a clear way to switch accounts/log out).

existing_features.title: Create the Whatchat app shell with core navigation: an authentication flow, a chat list view, a chat detail (thread) view, and a basic settings/profile view.

Implement an email-based account system (no phone number) that allows users to sign up, sign in, sign out, and persist their session across reloads. If true email verification is not possible, treat the email as an identifier (with clear UX copy indicating no verification).
Implement WhatsApp-style messaging (non-real-time): users can create/select 1:1 conversations, send text messages, and manually refresh to retrieve new messages.

Provide “app access” for making changes by adding clear developer-facing documentation and in-app pointers explaining how to modify the frontend/backend and redeploy to the Internet Computer using the project’s standard workflow.

Apply a cohesive, distinct visual theme for Whatchat (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) and enforce it consistently across Auth, Chat List, Thread, and Settings screens (avoid default template styling).
Add voice call and video call actions in the 1:1 chat thread UI so a user can start a voice or video call with the other participant in the conversation.
Implement an MVP call experience using WebRTC in the browser with controls for starting, accepting, ending, and handling permission errors for microphone/camera.
Add React Query hooks and UI refresh behavior for call signaling that works without real-time transport, using manual refresh and/or short-interval polling while the call UI is open.
Add an in-app "Switch account" option that signs the current user out and returns them to the authentication screen so they can sign in with a different Internet Identity.

Ensure the existing header logout action and the new "Switch account" action have consistent behavior: both must clear auth state, clear React Query cache, and redirect to the Auth screen, with clear English UX copy (e.g., optional confirmation dialog or toast).

Implement “online chat” behavior by automatically fetching new messages and conversation updates while the user is viewing chats, so users no longer need to manually press Refresh to see new messages.

Update user-facing UX copy in Chats and Chat Thread screens to reflect the new auto-updating behavior (remove or revise the existing “Messages are not real-time. Tap Refresh…” notices) using clear English.
Add React Query “fetcher” hooks for call signaling and integrate them with the call UI so the app can poll for offers/answers/candidates/status while a call modal is open.
Ensure WhatsApp-style auto-fetch polling is consistently applied to core chat data wherever it is shown, so users do not need to manually refresh to keep the UI up to date.
Generate an “amazing” chat wallpaper image set as static assets and commit them under frontend/public/assets/generated/ for use by the UI.

Apply the new wallpaper as the default background for chat-related screens: the Chat List screen main scroll area and the Chat Thread screen messages area, while preserving readability of message bubbles and content in both light and dark themes.

Implement an automatic sign-in restore flow so that when the app loads and an Internet Identity session/delegation already exists in the browser, the user is automatically taken into the app without needing to click “Sign In with Internet Identity”.

Prevent confusing Auth-screen UI flicker during initial authentication bootstrapping by showing an explicit initialization/loading state until the Internet Identity provider finishes determining whether a session is already authenticated.

Ensure the existing “Switch account” / sign-out flow continues to work correctly with auto-login: signing out must clear any locally-stored “last account” indicators used by the UI and must not immediately auto-redirect the user back into /chats unless they explicitly sign in again.

new_feature_requests.summary: Support login without phone number using email-based authentication
Provide user access to the app project (codebase/editor/build instructions) so they can modify and add changes
Add voice call and video call options to Whatchat

Add backend support for 1:1 call signaling and call session tracking (offer/answer/ICE candidates and basic call state) so two Whatchat users can establish a WebRTC connection without external services.
Add an in-app option to switch accounts (log out and sign in as a different email)
Add online (real-time) chat so messages update automatically without manual refresh
Add WhatsApp-like auto-fetch/polling “fetchers” across the app (e.g., chats list, threads/messages, conversation updates, and other relevant data) so content stays up to date without manual refresh
Add backend query endpoints needed for WhatsApp-style “fetchers” for WebRTC call signaling so the frontend can poll for call state without real-time transport.
Add an “amazing” chat wallpaper/background theme to the app UI (e.g., default wallpaper applied across chat screens)
Add auto-login to the last used account (remember last signed-in user and restore session automatically on app open)
